description: This program shows the implementations of all BST functions

description: This program showcases several recursive functions.

name: bmalhotra03/Pet-Adoption-Simulation
description: This program simulates a pet shelter and adoption menu, the user can add a pet to the shelter, and also adopt a pet from it, the program will always let the oldest animal get adopted first, implementation of a queue is being used here.

name: bmalhotra03/Reverse-Queue-Integers
description: This program reverses a set of k integers from a queue while leaving the others in the same order.

name: bmalhotra03/Expression-Evaluation
description: This program evaluates and calculates an expression provided by the user and also finds the average of a window of integers.

name: bmalhotra03/List-functions
description: This program allows the user to create a list and modify it with different functions.

name: bmalhotra03/Stack-Wars
description: This program simulates a card game using a Stack's functionality.

name: bmalhotra03/Cartesian-and-Polar-Coordinates
description: This project showcases modular class design with robust methods for geometric transformations, leveraging encapsulation and operator overloading to facilitate seamless interaction between different coordinate formats.

name: bmalhotra03/Region-Checker
description: This program uses structs/classes to check whether places are within a given region

name: bmalhotra03/Maze-Navigation
description: This program makes the user navigate through a maze using a stack and its functions.

name: bmalhotra03/Amusement-Park-Queue
description: This program simulates a queue at an amusement park, it has simulated time references

name: bmalhotra03/List-in-order
description: This program reads in data from a file and displays it in the original order based on the number index.

name: bmalhotra03/Pet-Farm
description: Designed and implemented a simulation involving different creature species and their interactions, with modular classes to manage attributes and behaviors. The project demonstrates advanced C++ object-oriented principles, including inheritance and encapsulation, to enable dynamic, extensible creature management and simulation.

name: bmalhotra03/Stopwatch-Data
description: This program processes timing data produced by a stopwatch and shows stats

name: bmalhotra03/Student-Data-Output
description: This program reads student data from a file and prints it out in a tabular format.

name: bmalhotra03/Memory-game
description: This program utilizes a 2D array to simulate a memory card game with the user.

name: bmalhotra03/Chutes-and-Ladders
description: This program simulates chutes and ladders for the user.

name: bmalhotra03/Integer-Guessing-Game
description: This project simply plays a guessing game with the user based on a range they provide as input.
